skill.name: algorithmic-art
skill.description: Creating algorithmic art using p5.js with seeded randomness and interactive parameter exploration. Use this when users request creating art using code, generative art, algorithmic art, flow fields, or particle systems. Create original algorithmic art rather than copying existing artists' work to avoid copyright violations.

security_audit.summary: Official skill from Anthropic repository. Minimal audit completed with no issues identified. Templates include standard CDN usage for p5.js only.

content.value_statement: You want original generative art but need a clear structure and reproducible results. This skill provides a philosophy workflow and a ready viewer template with seeded controls.
actual_capabilities: Defines a workflow to produce an algorithmic philosophy in a markdown file
Provides a full HTML viewer template with sidebar, seed controls, and actions
Includes parameter and color control UI scaffolding for live adjustments
Supports seeded randomness for reproducible p5.js output
Offers reset and random seed actions within the viewer UI
limitations: Relies on the p5.js CDN and does not bundle the library
Outputs a single self contained HTML artifact, not multi file projects
Requires manual customization of the algorithm and parameters
Does not generate static image files by itself

use_cases.title: Prototype a generative series
use_cases.description: Build a parameterized p5.js sketch with seed navigation for consistent variations.

use_cases.title: Teach algorithmic aesthetics
use_cases.description: Guide students from a philosophy statement to an interactive art viewer.

use_cases.title: Demo visual exploration
use_cases.description: Create a branded interactive artifact for showcasing generative options.

prompt_templates.title: Starter concept
prompt_templates.scenario: Beginner wants a simple flow field
prompt_templates.prompt: Create an algorithmic philosophy and a single HTML artifact for a calm flow field with seeded randomness and three adjustable parameters.

prompt_templates.title: Style driven brief
prompt_templates.scenario: Intermediate user wants a specific mood
prompt_templates.prompt: Build a philosophy and p5.js viewer for a minimal, airy composition using particle motion and soft color harmony.

prompt_templates.title: Parameter rich
prompt_templates.prompt: Design a philosophy and interactive artifact with at least five tunable parameters and optional color pickers.

prompt_templates.title: Conceptual seed
prompt_templates.scenario: Expert user needs a subtle reference
prompt_templates.prompt: Derive a subtle conceptual seed from my theme and express it in a generative algorithm with reproducible seeds.

output_examples.input: Create a generative art viewer inspired by ocean currents with adjustable speed and density.
output: Algorithmic philosophy describing flow, turbulence, and disciplined randomness
Self contained HTML viewer with seed navigation and parameter sliders
Notes on adjustable speed, density, and color palette choices

best_practices: Keep parameters limited to meaningful system properties
Use seeded randomness for repeatable outputs
Start from the provided viewer template structure
anti_patterns: Replacing the template layout or branding styles
Using unseeded randomness that breaks reproducibility
Adding unrelated UI sections beyond parameters and actions

faq.question: Is this compatible with Claude, Codex, and Claude Code?
faq.answer: Yes. The skill produces markdown and a single HTML file that works in common AI tooling.

faq.question: What are the limits of the generated art?
faq.answer: It is limited to p5.js in a single HTML artifact with inline code.

faq.question: How do I integrate this into a website?
faq.answer: Embed the generated HTML or extract the canvas code into your site.

faq.question: Does it send data anywhere?
faq.answer: No. The template runs locally in the browser without data transmission.

faq.question: What if the viewer does not render?
faq.answer: Check that the p5.js CDN is reachable and that the script has no errors.

faq.question: How does it compare to other generative tools?
faq.answer: It focuses on a philosophy to code workflow with reproducible seeds and a fixed UI template.
